_comment: Created by ianb on 14/10/2013 11:43:47 using v0.9
title: How has the proportion of older people living at home after discharge changed by provider?
analysis_commentary: Despite the national proportion not changing much over time, we can see here that this is not consistent across all providers; 65 providers improved their performance in 2012/13. The remaining 82 providers had a decrease in the proportion of older people still at home 91 days after discharge. Ten providers had more than a 10% decrease in performance from 2011/12 to 2012/13, with the greatest decrease being 30.2%.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Adult Social Care - Combined Activity Return (ASC-CAR)
